result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley A. Roche

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:43 PM Defendant Bradley A. Roche in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Bradley A. Roche.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues. PD's office will appointing new counsel.  Set for TSC.

10:12 AM Defendant Bradley A. Roche in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Bradley A. Roche.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Atty Getsinger requests arraignment be set out.  Matter reset.
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley A. Roche in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for Bradley A. Roche.  Atty Getsinger requests PH.  State responds re: possible conflict.  Atty Getsinger is still discussing an offer.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Return date on June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Reside w/J.M. or another adult approved by agent.  Actively seek and maintain full time employment. Make all scheduled appointments with agent.  No contact w/R.F.H. or his residence; No contact w/K.J.

03:38 PM Defendant Bradley A. Roche in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Bradley A. Roche in custody.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond.  State objects to motion.  Atty. Getsinger has some additional facts-established living arrangements, EMP from agent, remains on supervision and gives argument.  Amend to $500 cash or signature bond.  On supervision for another year.  State makes argument. Court reduces cash bond to $500 CASH other conditions remain but to include:  Reside with Jason Mack or another adult approved by agent Actively seek and maintain full time employment.  Make all scheduled appointments with agent.
Motion hearing on April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

02:43 PM Defendant Bradley A. Roche in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Getsinger.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A. Roche appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney. DE does qualify for PD representation.   State requests $5000.00 CASH bond.  Atty. Getsinger makes argument for signature bond, warrants history are dated.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing. $5000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with R.F.H. or his residence; No contact w/K.J.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
